DataElement.preferredName: Bioassay Reference Material Use Make Cutoff Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response to a question that asks if reference material was used to generate the cutoff.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Bioassay Reference Material Use Make Cutoff
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A method of measuring the effects of a biologically active substance using an intermediate in vivo or in vitro tissue or cell model under controlled conditions. (from MSH98)_A short note acknowledging a source of information or quoting a passage._The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object._Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose._Form from constituents._A designated limit beyond which something cannot function or must be terminated.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A laboratory test/analysis of biological activity of a substance by studying its effect on an organism or in test tube under controlled conditions.

Concepts.definition: A laboratory test or analysis of the biological activity of a substance performed by studying its effect on an organism or in a test tube under controlled conditions.

Property.preferredDefinition: A short note acknowledging a source of information or quoting a passage.:The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.:Use; put into service; make work or employ (something) for a particular purpose or for its inherent or natural purpose.:Form from constituents.:A designated limit beyond which something cannot function or must be terminated.

Concepts.definition: A note acknowledging a source of information or quoting a passage.
The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.
A manner, or usual, or accepted practice of using something.
A designated limit beyond which something cannot function, must be terminated, or no longer applies.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator of Yes, No, or Unknown to represent a condition.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Updated to add NCIt concept relationship. Updated VM Short Name to be the Public ID to be consistent with current convention for VM Short Name - DW 10-03-2022
ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.29 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. ak

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: DCTD (Division of Cancer Treatment and Diagnosis)
